# MTLStorageMode.managed

**Case**

The CPU and GPU may maintain separate copies of the resource, and any changes need to be explicitly synchronized.

## Declaration

```swift
case managed
```

## Discussion

On Intel-based Mac computers, this is the default storage mode for [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLTexture] objects. In iOS and tvOS, the managed storage mode isn’t available. With managed storage, you synchronize changes between the CPU and GPU manually. For instructions and examples of resource synchronization, see [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/synchronizing-a-managed-resource-in-macos].

For more guidance on how to choose storage modes, see [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/setting-resource-storage-modes].

## Storage mode options

- **MTLStorageMode.shared**: The CPU and GPU share access to the resource, allocated in system memory.
- **MTLStorageMode.private**: The resource is only available to the GPU.
- **MTLStorageMode.memoryless**: The resource’s contents are only available to the GPU, and only exist temporarily during a render pass.
